data.author: Lowell Camp

changelog.release_notes: Bugsmashing: Fixed Swopping bug at 12:00 noon and 12:00 midnight.
Bugsmashing: Corrected month display to read identically to hour number

This is a quick design idea I've been mulling over for awhile. Hope you enjoy!
The hour and minutes hands are pretty standard: The long one is the minutes hand, the short inner hand is the hours hand.
The ticks for seconds and hours have some extra functionality: Minute ticks fill in for days of the month, and the hour ticks fill in according to the month. The weekday is also written in the center of the screen!

data.description:
Conveys date, day of the week, and time through a fun, contrasty design inspired by boolean logic!

The hour ticks fill in based on the month, and the minute ticks fill in based on the day of the month.

latest_release.release_notes: Bugsmashing: Fixed Swopping bug at 12:00 noon and 12:00 midnight.

data.title: Boolean

Jetzt als angepasste deutsche Version mit vielen Optionen:

data.author: chops
data.description:
This is based on the new casio g-shock g700 series.  Not an exact replica, but a pretty close adaptation.

The digital display can show digital time, US date(mmdd), or international format date (ddmm).  Below are indicators for BT connection, 24 hour format, and quiet time (QT).  In the upper left circle it will indicate what the digital display is showing - time, date + US, or date + INT. Upper right is the battery level.

There are 5 background schemes to choose from.

Seconds, and/or second tick marks, can be turned on/off.

All hand colours are configurable, as well as the hand outline colours.
data.title: P-Shock

data.author: Bagus
data.description:
This a watchface ported from "CoroWatch" writted java language, this watch not show 24 hours, just 12 hours are supported

Time written just readable one segmen, example time

1:09 = one nine
1:10 = one ten
2:11 = two eleven
4:13 = four one three
10:00 = ten right
10:30 = ten three zero
10:56 = ten five six

it also support action shake to see date, day and battery status.

Don't forget to tap ‚ù§Ô∏è button for support me üòçüëç

data.author: dezign999
data.description:
dHunt is a retro inspired watchface for your Pebble! Features health integration and random animation. Ducks represent 100 steps, flick to see total steps. Bullet gauge represents battery charge remaining. Thanks to everyone on Reddit for the feature requests!
Features:
‚Ä¢ Customizable Vibration alerts
‚Ä¢ Flick to animate and flick again to shoot!
‚Ä¢ Optional Vibration FX
‚Ä¢ Random flight patterns
‚Ä¢ Optional Date display
‚Ä¢ Date format settings

data.description:
ISAC (Intelligent System Analytic Computer) is a computer or digital assistant that is used by a SHD Agent in the game The Division. 

Choose a theme to match your style:
Tech [Orange]
Security [Blue]
Medical [Green]
Dark Zone [Purple]
Rogue [Red]
Custom [Color Picker]

-Choosing a theme will change the icon above the battery meter
-The icon will change to a no-bluetooth icon when out of range and will also subtly vibrate

----------------------------------------------
This watch face was heavily inspired by the game The Division. I loved the UI/UX so much that I wanted to create a version for my favorite watch. 
----------------------------------------------

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed a problem with 24-hour time not displaying correctly.

data.title: ISAC v1

data.author: RadiantRhinos

changelog.release_notes:
- Themes! Watchface now contains a few in-built themes. As always, you can change any color you want.
- Added Yahoo! weather support for those who do not want to sign up for an API key.
Fix a bug where vibrations were enabled even when turned off.

This release makes the following changes:

- Optimize health access for battery efficiency.
- If the weather cannot be retrieved, the watch face shows "Pebble" and/or watch model, if available.

Thanks for all the feedback & love! This release implements the following: 

- Ability to hide the top and bottom complications (weather, battery & health). 
- Health can now display distance or steps.

data.description:
Glance is a watch face that is focused on readable information. 

Shows time, date, day, month, weather, battery and health info that you can read quickly by just glancing at the screen. Anti-aliased text for better readability. Colors, health metric and weather provider can be customized. Additionally, weather, battery or health data can be hidden if desired.

100% Free!
 
Please don't forget to leave a ‚ù§ if you enjoy using Glance!

latest_release.release_notes:
- Themes! Watchface now contains a few in-built themes. As always, you can change any color you want.
- Added Yahoo! weather support for those who do not want to sign up for an API key.

data.author: Nev Rawlins
data.description:
Digital watchface - read between the slashes to find the digits that display the time.  It is similar to Latitude, but this time, each flattened digit is slanted.

Displays in 12 or 24 hour mode, depending on watch setting.


Configuration options:
- show / hide AM/PM at top (if in 12-hour mode)
- show / hide battery level at bottom
- change time and background colors


Image cycles through the various display options:
(1) 10:25 
(2) 07:14AM 
(3) 08:37AM 
(3) 12:59PM
(4) 18:46 (24-hour mode)


This design was created by Heather Sable Villano and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio. It is published with the designer's permission. 

The original design can be found here: 
https://blog.tokyoflash.com/2013/06/24/slash-an-lcd-watch-in-negative-space/
data.title: Slash

changelog.release_notes:
Version 1.6
=======
Battery level. Enable this from the settings to get the current battery level displayed at 9 o'clock.

Version 1.5
=======
- Step count. Enable it in the settings to get the current day's step count.
- Pixel pushing for legibility.

Version 1.4
=======
- New custom made font. A little larger and much, much easier to read.
- Temperature support.

Version 1.2
=======
- Quiet time indicator
- Support other languages for weekday names

data.author: nzvoyager

changelog.release_notes:
This watch face is the 3rd version of my Multi-Watch build version 1.9. This watch Face is for Basalt only. This watch face will display the current weather details from the closet local weather underground weather station in your area. To get this working you will need to get a free API developer key from the following URL and the enter this in the API area in the Watch Face settings area.
https://www.wunderground.com/weather/api/d/pricing.html?MR=1
The weather details shown are : temperature, wind speed, wind chill, wind direction, UV level, air pressure, weather station location and general local weather icon. Also step count, time, AM/PM, week day, date, battery level and bluetooth. Weather is updated 1 hourly but can be updated every 5 minutes by a wrist shake. The wrist shake function can also be turned off. Screen background, font/icons and line colours can also be separately changed.

data.author: Nev Rawlins
data.description:
Design inspired by the robots that appeared in classic sci-fi movies. It‚Äôs called ‚ÄúEOBOT‚Äù because it uses different colored lights to indicate even (E) and odd (O) digits and the pattern of lights with a circular head forms the shape of a robot.

The first 4 vertical columns of lights indicate the 4-digit time or date - in each column, one light is illuminated as either a blue light (even digit) or a pink light (odd digit). The top light in each column represents either 0 or 1, the second one down 2 or 3 etc.  

the 2 lights in the column on the far right side indicate whether time or date is being displayed - top: time, bottom: date. 

If configured on, the red eye moves from side to side, like a Cylon's, on a glance (when watchface faces up). 

Displays in 12 or 24-hour mode, depending on watch settings.


Configuration options:
1. Eye movement enabled/disabled
 a. Duration of the eye movement (2, 3 or 4 seconds)
2. Activating date on a shake enabled/disabled
 a. Date in MMDD or DDMM format
 b. Duration date display stays on (5, 10 or 15 seconds).

Note. The longer the duration, for each, the greater the impact on the battery.

Images:
1. Animation: eye movement at 12:38
2. Animation cycling through 12:38 to 12:42
3. Date: 09/25 (September 25)
4. Midnight (12-hour mode)
5. Midnight (24-hour mode)


Designed by Lloyd King and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio. The watchface is published with his permission.

Original design can be found at 
https://blog.tokyoflash.com/2011/12/23/eobot-watch-re-animates-classic-sci-fi-on-your-wristzzz/
data.title: EOBOT

data.author: ttmm
data.description:
This is a paid watchface. $0.99 + local taxes. You have one day trial. Payment is handled through KiezelPay www.kzl.io/acttmm

ACTTMM - like in an analog watch, the outside squares are hours and now is marked with a hole. Inside - a small square stands for one minute a bigger square is a five-minute period. You can setup bottom line with extra informations like: steps, distance, active time, date, temperature or year. You can activate details after shake and set up 4 lines with extras: week day, week number, year, seconds, temperature. More settings: temperature F or C, date in EU or US format, hourly vibration, BT alerts and status, hour and background color customization. Watchface uses Pebble Master Key for Wunderground weather. Date language localization: English, Fran√ßais, Deutsch, Espa√±ol, Italiano, Polski. ACTTMM is 4.0 ready. TTMM collection won Silver and Gold A Design Award in Interface and Interaction Design Category. Design: Albert Salamon. Programming: Gregoire Sage. Copyrights ¬© Albert Salamon 2017
data.title: ACTTMM

data.author: giacomo

changelog.release_notes: The very first release of the english version of the beloved italian "approssimazione" watchface.

data.description: Approximation always displays an approximate time. The basic idea is that there is no exact time, so it's pointless to beat around the bush. Thus, if it says that is ten to six, it could be fifty past five, or fifty-two past five or whatsoever... If you shake your wrist or you tap on the watch, the watchface will refresh, with all the implications this could have... Sometimes it allows itself to suggest something, sometimes it will not answer directly to the question you're implicitly asking to the watch. If you have got some ideas about this watchface, please do write me! Thanks to Douwe Maan, I've started from his code, since I was completely new to C language. If you like this watchface and you would like to encourage me, donations are welcome (even, of course, a cheap, Italian coffee!): you can find the donate button in the setting page of the watchface (which, by the way, you cannot actually configure right now...).
data.title: Approximation

On the right can set upper extra line to temperature, steps, acive time or date. You can activate details after shake and set up 4 lines with extras: temperature, steps, active time, week day, week number and year. data.author: Dallan

changelog.release_notes: Squashed a new bug that hopefully you didn't have time to find.

- Added inactivity alert. If you are sitting/inactive for more than 30 minutes (35 to be exact), the sleep icon is replaced with a reminder to get up. Avoiding long periods of inactivity has been reported as important to maintaining good health, even for those who regularly exercise.
- Changed icon levels from 2, 5, 8 to 4, 7, 10 to increase the significance of each icon level (thumbs up, fist bump, strong arm).
- Moon shown all the time and placeholder time shown instead of blank if no sleep detected

- Sleep threshold for consideration is now 4 hours. Less than 4 hours, sleep is left out of score.
- Icon and text appearance set to new thresholds. 2000 steps needed to earn first shoe.
- Changed threshold/maxout for sleep penalties and trigger for assuming watch was not worn during sleep.

- Tried to make sure hr-points cleared overnight
- Updated some icons
- Set no-sleep trigger to be more generous

data.description:
Watchface displays:
(line 1) Date, acheivement icon, cumulative health score
(line 2) Big, clear, clean, simple time
(line 3) Category health level icons: sleep/inactivity, steps, heart rate
(line 4) Category health values
(bottom) Battery slider

Details:
- Get moon & stars if within 10 minutes of average amount of sleep. If inactive for more than 30 minutes, sleep icon replaced with reminder to get up and move about. This idle alert can help remind you to not be sedentary (unhealthy!) for extends periods of time. 
- Get shoe icon with 2000 steps, shoe & wings at 10k steps
- Add heart to cardiograph icon after about 10 minutes of elevated heart rate (over 120 bpm), even faster for higher heart rates
- Cumulative health score in top right incorporates active time, steps, sleep (vs. average), and elevated heart rate time into a total health score for the day. Lack of sleep can put you negative. Not wearing watch at night triggers total score to ignore sleep contribution to score. Level up your icon from "hp" (health points) to thumbs up, to fist-bump, to strong arm as your health score increases during the day.

Also includes disconnected bluetooth icon.

latest_release.release_notes: Squashed a new bug that hopefully you didn't have time to find.

data.title: Level Up Health

data.description:
Minimalistic watchface.
The time is displayed by a ring going from the hour mark clockwise to the minute mark (just imagine the hour hand pointing to the start of the ring and the minute hand pointing to the end of the ring)
Watch battery status is indicated by the color of the ring (going from green to red, yellow being 50%).
Background gets a red teint when the watch is disconnected from the phone.

Pretty is a minimalist watchface with the time at a glance, plus a lot of useful information.

data.author: Nev Rawlins
data.description:
Another watchface design using color & digits to show time and date. This one has boxes appearing in analog positions.

The outer set of boxes show the time. 
If there are 2 boxes colored differently, the empty one represents the hour and the other the 10-minutes with the digit inside being the additional single minutes.  
If there is only one colored box, this is the position for both the hour and the 10-minute.
The area around the outer boxes is colored to indicate PM.

The inner boxes show the date in the same way.  
If there are 2 boxes colored differently, the empty one represents the month and the other 10 days with the digit inside being the additional single days.  
If there is only one colored box, this is the position for both the month and the 10 days.

The battery level appears in the center, but can be hidden. The background color depicts the status of the battery:
>50% Green
30-50% Yellow
<30% Red

All colors are configurable.


Image:
Animation cycling through:
(1)   4:57PM 24th August
(2)   6:43AM 19th July
(3) 11:29AM 30th November
(4)   2:06PM 2nd October
(5)   8:17AM 28th April (no battery)


This is my design based on the concept of boxes and digits that Bryan Kollar passed to me.
data.title: AnalogBoxes

data.author: Dallan

changelog.release_notes:
* New icon for no bluetooth
* Reward emojis now appear at scores of 2 (thumbs up - you're on your way!), 5 (fist bump - good job!), and 8 (strong arm - you're a champ!)
* Special achievement emojis given at 10,000 steps (sparkle heart - good for your heart), hit you average sleep (OK hand - well done!)

- Set health status bar to disappear on minute change
- Health status bar still available "on tap"
- Health score updates every 15 minutes
- BT icon instead of text

* Modified health score to reflect original intent of awarding ~1 pt / 15 minutes of exercise through based on activity time and steps (emphasis on activity time).
* Added health stats bar at bottom which is available "on tap." Just tap the screen to see. When the next significant health update is received, the bar will disappear. Bar includes heart rate (bpm), minutes of activity, and thousands of steps achieved.

* Updated sleep scoring to not penalize if you didn't sleep with your watch on
* Updated sleep scoring to not penalize more than 5 points for lack of sleep
* Updated icon pack to better reflect your status (sleepy -> smile -> thumbs up!)
* Finally figured out how to properly get average sleep time for accurate comparison. So sleep score contribution is correct and therefore total health score is correct.

* Fixed bug in health score that prevented a positive contribution from sleep time 
* Changed sleep baseline from 7.5 hours to user's average daily sleep, penalizing user 1 pt/15 minutes for being under average sleep, and earning up a maximum of 1 pt for sleep above daily average. Beyond 15 minutes extra, no more points are awarded. 
* Removed pulse on disconnect, but you still get the status update of "No BT"

- Added bluetooth indicator and vibration for disconnect
- Added three levels of icons: ice cream (negative score), exercise duck (0-3), and achievement popper (4+)
- Raised battery bar for pebble round
1st release with health score, time, date, and minimalist battery status slider.

data.description:
TocClock3 provides time and date in a clear format with a discrete battery slider across the bottom and a health score in the top right. Health score is based on sleep, amount of activity time and number of steps. App is written in C with close attention paid to preserving battery life. Includes Bluetooth on-screen disconnection indication (no vibration). 

Health score guide: negative scores result from less than user's average hours of sleep, with a point lost per 15 minutes. Up to 1 point can be earned for extra sleep. Exercise should yield a point every 15 minutes or so. Health icon has three levels: ice cream (negative score), exercise duck (0-3), and achievement popper (4+).

latest_release.release_notes:
* New icon for no bluetooth
* Reward emojis now appear at scores of 2 (thumbs up - you're on your way!), 5 (fist bump - good job!), and 8 (strong arm - you're a champ!)
* Special achievement emojis given at 10,000 steps (sparkle heart - good for your heart), hit you average sleep (OK hand - well done!)

data.title: TocClock3

data.author: Nev Rawlins
data.description:
A stylish digital watchface with time moving down the strings.  The digits are partially masked by the strings.   The time can be displayed on 6 strings (HH:MM:SS) or 4 (HH:MM) - the later is the battery save option.

The central row of digits, in the same color as the strings, are the current time, the row below the previous time and the row above the next time, accurate to minutes or seconds depending on whether the 'show seconds' option has been selected.

The symbols at the top right are AM (above) and PM (below), shown if in 12-hour mode. The other symbols on the right are for date display.  


If 'show date on shake' is selected, the date will display (in either MMDDYY or DDMMYY format). The letters represent the days of the week from Sunday to Saturday), the symbol above these represents D for date.  The length of time the date is shown is also configurable.

As with the time, the central row is the current time, bottom the previous day and top the next day.


All colors are configurable if choose not to use the default color selection.


Images:
(1) Showing time from 08:32:48PM to 08:33:00PM
(2) Cycling through: 09:22PM, 21:24 (in 24-hour mode), 12:35AM, Fri 08/04/17


This watchface design was created by Jos√© Manuel Otero, from Spain, and is published with his permission.   You can follow him on:
https://www.facebook.com/TTM-Technotimemachine-578290348850436/timeline/
data.title: Strings

data.author: Nev Rawlins
data.description:
Digital watchface with the digits‚Äô outlines formed by overlapping squares and rectangles.  The shapes of each digit build each minute.   Hours at the top, minutes at the bottom. 

Displays in 12 or 24-hour mode, depending on watch settings.

Configuration options:
1. Hide/show leading zero for hours
2. Background color can be configured
3. Colors of small shapes & box can be configured (same or different)


Images:
1. Animation cycling through time from 12:34 to 12:36 (same then different colors)

2. Animation cycling through
a) 09:58
b) 07:46
c)   7:46 (i.e.no leading zero)
d) 23:59 (24-hour)
e) 11:59 (12-hour)

3. How to spot the digits


Designed by Lloyd King and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio. The watchface is published with his permission.

Original design can be found at https://blog.tokyoflash.com/2012/08/06/geometrik-lcd-watch-is-both-artistic-and-cryptic/

data.author: chops
data.description:
--------------
Beta version
--------------

A simple watchface, not app, that shows Light sleep, Deep sleep, Average daily sleep.

When Bluetooth is disconnected the time inverts and date disappears.

The z's at the bottom indicate battery strength.

-----------------------
IMPORTANT Notes:
-----------------------

The watch doesn't send sleep data continuously. It has a buffer and collects data for a while, then sends it to the phone. If bluetooth connectivity is temporarily lost, it just waits to send the data when it is restored. 

The daily Avg. is calculated throughout the day, so will change.

If you don't move a lot (aren't very active), the watch may think you are sleeping, so count that too.

It will take a few days for the average number to start looking 'right'.

From my testing so far, figures shown on the watchface are the same as other apps/watchfaces, but these are not the same as in the pebble phone app, which likely does other calculations.

And, the watch doesn't seem to update in the morning until your phone 'lock screen' is de-activated.  So don't be alarmed if you still see "0" - it still needs to update itself.


Please let me know if numbers aren't looking right.
data.title: SleepyTime

data.description:
A horizontal version of my Activ8 watchface. I've used a slightly different font. The time can be filled or an outline.

Top left is BT and quiet-time.

Permanent widgets are,
Weather (temp & icon)
Battery (circle & num)


For rectangular watches which support Health, the two right widgets are customisable.

choose either,

- health arcs
- step count & person icon
- step arcs
- HR (for P2HR)


Health arcs are,
- step count (outermost)
- calories
- active time
- distance

Step arcs are,
- current step count (outer)
- daily step average (inner)

All widgets are constantly visible on a PTR, so no widget options.
The weather icon is larger on non-health firmware.

data.description:
Watchface using color & digits to show time and date, as requested by Bryan Kollar on Pebble Junkies  


The top 12 boxes are used to depict the time  

If there are 2 boxes colored differently:  
Count the boxes from top left to right, then same with the next rows until you get to the empty one colored differently  - that's the hour
The box containing the digit is the 10-minute
The digit is the single minute
Note for 01 - 09 minutes, the 12th box is colored

If there is only one colored box, this is the position for both the hour and the 10-minute

The bottom row, contains a box for AM/PM and 3 boxes for the date which can be in MM-DD-YY or DD-MM-YY format


The background color depicts the status of the battery:
>50% Green
30-50% Yellow
<30% Red


All colors apart from the background and the box borders are configurable


Images:
(1) Animation cycling showing 4:38PM to 4:42PM on July 22 2017, battery level 50% to 40%

(2) Animation cycling showing 6:59AM to 7:01AM on June 20 2017 (DD-MM-YY format), battery level 20%


Designed by Bryan Kollar and published with his permission (at his request!)

data.author: Nicholas Knouf
data.description:
Consider your role in the universe by understanding the relationship between light from stars afar and your own history and future.

On Your Wrist is the Universe: Every moment again is a watchface that generates new poems based on what stars are in the sky. Using your current location, the watchface calculates which stars are above (even during the day, the stars are still there) and creates unique texts based off of the stars' characteristics. New poems are generated every ten minutes.

On Your Wrist is the Universe is a series of generative poems that draw inspiration from the materials of the universe.

data.author: Tor Harrington

changelog.release_notes:

data.description:
Do you live in London? Do you travel by the Tube? Ever wonder if it's a good time to get on that train or find an alternative due to delays? Well with Tube Time, at a glance, you can easily check the tube has a good service or not.

This is a simple analogue face with the date and month represented using a digital font. The hour markers around the watch function as the time markers but also represent the various tube lines and their status on the network. The beauty is that even without the status, the watchface functions as a watch first with the status updates secondary. For those who don't travel by tube or live in London it can be a fashionable face!

The tube lines are coloured to their nearest equivalent colour on the Pebble to represent a particular line. For example, the red 1 o'clock position is for the Central line. The lines are also in alphabetical order starting from the 12 o'clock position as follows:

12 - Bakerloo
1 - Central
2 - Circle
3 - District
4 - DLR
5 - Hammersmith & City
6 - Jubilee
7 - Metropolitan
8 - Northern
9 - Piccadilly
10 - Victoria
11 - Waterloo & City

To make things simple, the status of the tube is fetched every minute or when the face is refreshed such and when it is first loaded. The shape of the markers will change to represent the status of the line as follows:

circle - good service
diamond - minor delays
triangle - severe delays
square - major delays or no service

latest_release.release_notes:
features 12 tube lines

day of week
day of month
support Pebble Round, Pebble Time Steel, Pebble 2

data.title: Tube Time

data.title: FLATTMM

data.author: Nev Rawlins
data.description:
Digital watchface with 2 display modes and 3 digit styles.

The digits are formed from a set of shapes appearing within larger shapes (rectangles or circles).  Each full digit appears in 3 of the larger shapes at an oblique angle (hence the name).

The 2 modes are "Separate digits" or "Joined digits" which describe the layout of the full digits.  The separate digits are easier to distinguish than the joined ones where part of 2 digits appear in the same larger shape.

The 3 styles:
1. Digits formed from rounded rectangles
2. Digits formed from lines coming out of central circles
3. Digits formed from arcs coming out of central circles 
The central circles in the last two appear in the 3 large shapes for each digit even if the lines or arcs do not, so just focus on the ones with the other shapes.


The background and shape colors are also configurable.


Images:
Animation cycling through the following times/modes/styles:
(1) 12:53 / separate / rounded rectangles
(2) 05:26 / separate / lines
(3) 07:48 / separate / arcs
(4) 10:34 / joined / rounded rectangles
(5) 09:27 / joined / lines
(6) 08:59 / joined / arcs


Designed by Lloyd King and published with his permission.
data.title: Oblique

data.description:
Configurable sliding text watch face based on the example. Background and foreground colors configurable.
Toggles to enable heart rate, step count, day of week, date, and backlight on charge. Text alignment is also supported.

Bottom bar shows battery level unobtrusively.

latest_release.release_notes:
* Fix dummy health data when health disabled
* Fix HR data not updating

data.title: Sliding Text Improved

data.author: Kieselleger
data.description:
This watchface is a tribute to the very early digital watches with these glowing battery killing displays. Time could only be read after a button press and after a couple of seconds the screen returned to dark. Unfortunately there's no way to receive a button press in a watchface application. Therefore you'll have to shake your watch to see the time. Several configurations are available, as there are:

- background color
- text color
- text size
- display timeout
- 24-hour-display
- date on 2nd shake
- date format
- light
data.title: LED Vintage

data.author: ttmm

changelog.release_notes: New icon and Pebble Watch improvements

data.description:
This is a paid watchface. $0.99 + local taxes. You have 24h trial. Payment is handled through KiezelPay www.kzl.io/lasttmm 

LASTTMM - the hidden fortress. There is 12 fortresses of hours build from minutes and quarters, where small square stands for 5 minutes period. Now you can build your castle of life. You can see more information after a shake and set up lines with: date, weekday, week number, year, steps, distance, active time and temperature. More settings: temperature F or C, date in EU or US format, hourly vibration, BT alerts and status, time color customization. Watchface uses Pebble Master Key for Wunderground weather. Date language localization: English, Fran√ßais, Deutsch, Espa√±ol, Italiano, Polski. LASTTMM is 4.0 ready. Design: Albert Salamon. Programming: Gregoire Sage. Copyrights ¬© Albert Salamon 2017
